title: Why is Poacher's Dirk a thing?
body: I know this is unimportant and very small, but why buy {{item:3252}}? I know it transforms into a {{item:3134}}  after killing 3 monsters from the enemy jungle but it has a 60 sec cooldown in between each monster killed, meaning that by the time you actually transform this thing you probably either farmed up or just passively generated enough gold to actually buy a serrated dirk. So why the hell would I actually waste 750 Gold on this?

It was probably aimed towards {{champion:203}} and other counter junglers. If youre building a {{item:3142}} you can buy {{item:3252}} first and then turn it into a {{item:3134}} while you are saving for {{item:3142}}.

I think it's more a reward for an assassin who can't roam from mid lane. 

For example, {{champion:91}} may be pressured in lane and can't roam, but if he buys this he can hop over the wall, grab some raptors and get back to lane. Enemy camps take 2 minutes to respawn so the 60 second cooldown isn't that big a deal if you're in mid lane.

If you have the ability to push in the lane and take raptors, you are better off pushing in the lane and applying pressure on the map.  I'm talking Talon here btw, also his w doesn't 1 shot the little raptors so he is going to take a lot of damage from it.
At present, yes. We have Poacher's Dirk if roaming ever becomes a poor strategy for AD assassins (such as if towers get buffed to a dangerous level or warding becomes too common in the lane phase).

As for top lane if you're Blue side you're SOL because Krug's take too damn long to take. Taking wolves is risky for most laners because of how deep you have to go to get them.

It might actually be worth buying if Scuttle counted...
But scuttle is everyone's camp, so it isnt really counter jungling.

Honestly, if were going to compare it to cull, I should point out that even with a 60 second CD, it only goes on CD after the first, so it will only take about 2 minutes to stack if you're optimizing for it. 

Conversely, Cull needs 100 minion kills, and I think waves come every 30 seconds. So fully stacking cull would take several minutes to actually fully stack up. 

The thing with poacher's knife is, it's kinda designed to be niche as it encourages poaching camps from your enemies. One issue is that it could be difficult to balance. cause if a Jungler starts snowballing, poaching camps is a given. Though for Riot to explore the poaching play style, this works way better than the old poacher's knife from season 5. Simply because once you bought it, it had to be your main focus, and the enemy could easily counter it. (shutting you down for good) 

But with this rendition, the act of poaching is a temporary strat that can give you a boost. But that said, making it upgrade to a Lethality item, limits the champion pool, who would try this in the first place. Also not useful super Early, as Dirk doesn't upgrade into any of the current tier 3 jungle items.
I just think it's a massive investment for a very small reward. Maybe it would have been fine without the cooldown, clearing an entire side of the enemy jungle is not easy.
